text:
<@U4H19D1D2> it wasn't the 1000 orders (but have built a function to handle that now, based your BFLW example), but I added this line (under line 26 in your example) and it appears to work (have tried locally and on AWS and it seems to pick up orders placed on either and importantly not duplicate, which seemed to be happening previously, it appeared the middleware and flumine were both adding the orders placed via the current host without the line below):

```if current_order.customer_strategy_ref != config.hostname or current_order.status != 'EXECUTABLE':```
